post_title: What's the biggest supermarket/hypermarket in Cologne?

comments.author: marvis303
comments.body: Globus in Marsdorf is pretty big.

comments.author: ilovejjajjang
comments.body: Globus in Marsdorf, maybe HIT in Braunsfeld?

comments.author: Creeyu
comments.body: Metro and Handelshof. Or directly at the Großmarkt, theres a couple of big places (but mainly B2B)

comments.author: Schlecklecker69
comments.body: Yep Hauptstr. 128 - 3.850 m² - with over 40.000 products

comments.author: corthammer
comments.body: kaufland in ehrenfeld is also pretty big

comments.author: Level_Fish_7248
comments.body:
Is it the largest supermarket in Cologne? No idea - but definitely the largest Rewe store

[https://www.rewe-istas.de](https://www.rewe-istas.de)

comments.author: craftymacshank
comments.body: That’s in Erftstadt.. biggest in Cologne is probably some REWE Center or the Selgros (members only) markets

comments.author: Schlecklecker69
comments.body: Istas is also in Rodenkirchen. The biggest Rewe in Cologne

comments.author: Level_Fish_7248
comments.body: Phu - I am not sure, but isn‘t METRO larger than Selgros? Well - maybe not longer since METRO is changing their system … But nevertheless both are members only ….
